alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, southeastern King and Queen, northeastern Charles City, southeastern New Kent and northwestern James City Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Holdcroft, or 7 miles west of Toano, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Toano around 315 PM EDT. Barhamsville around 320 PM EDT. West Point around 335 PM EDT. Shacklefords around 340 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Holly Forks, Eltham, Chickahominy Shore, York River State Park, Croaker, Gressit, Lanexa, Mattaponi, Warren Mill and Diascund. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; New Kent
